A schematic illustration of the increase of RMSE with forecast time. The pre-NWP forecaster started from a persistence forecast which he skillfully extrapolated into the future, converging towards climate for longer ranges

with forecast time. The

persistence forecast
which he skillfully

future, converging

picture.caption: • The time unit can be anything from hours to days depending on the parameter (hours for clouds, days for temperature) Anders Persson SMHI NCEP 18 June 2004

A good NWP model is able to simulate all atmospheric scales throughout the forecast. It has the same variance as the observations and the persistence forecasts, which
A good NWP model
is able to simulate
all atmospheric
scales throughout
the forecast. It has
the same variance
as the observations
and the persistence
forecasts, which

yields an error
yields an error

saturation level 41% above the climate
saturation level
41% above the
climate

forecast

The way out of the dilemma:
The way out of the
dilemma:

Combine the high accuracy of NWP in the short range with a filtering of the non- predictable scales for longer ranges
Combine the high
accuracy of NWP in
the short range with a
filtering of the non-
predictable scales for
longer ranges

This can be done both with and without the EPS
This can be done both
with and without the
EPS

page.title:
Jumpiness in 2 m T forecasts (Karlstad)
Jumpiness in 2 m T forecasts (Karlstad)
page.normal_text:
error level for climatological statements
error level for climatological statements

EPS ensemble mean
EPS ensemble mean

The ensemble mean is not only the most accurate, it is by far also the least “jumpy” • While the T511 makes an average 24 hour “jump” of 2 - 4°K, the T255 ensemble mean is stable at around 1° K
The ensemble
mean is not only
the most accurate,
it is by far also the
least “jumpy”

1° K

page.title:
The EPS contains a lot of information, spread out in several locations
The EPS contains
a lot of
information,
spread out in
several locations

picture.caption: Anders Persson SMHI NCEP 18 June 2004 One solution is to create ”synoptic” EPS maps in the old Bergen School tradition: combine several parameters in the same map!
